meanings.definition: A monetary unit of Tunisia, equal to one thousandth of a dinar.
meanings.sent1: In Tunisia, you can buy a lot with just one millime.
meanings.sent2: I found a millime on the street today.
meanings.sent3: The millime rolled away, playing hide and seek with the dinar.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like a millime in a sea of coins, small but precious.
meanings.sent5: The shiny millime sparkled under the sun, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.sent1: I used a millime to pay for the candy.
meanings.sent2: The vending machine only accepts coins, even a millime.
meanings.sent3: The millime jumped happily into the piggy bank, joining its coin friends.
meanings.sent4: His words were as valuable as a rare millime, cherished by all who heard them.
meanings.sent5: The old millime had been passed down through generations, a symbol of luck and prosperity.
